content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers:
The target structure consists of 8 blocks total, arranged in 2 layers:
- Bottom layer: 4 blocks (2 red arch blocks, 2 yellow semicircular blocks)
- Top layer: 4 blocks (2 tall yellow rectangular blocks, 2 green rectangular blocks)

## Spatial Relationships:
- Bottom layer: Two red arch blocks (with semicircular cutouts) are placed side by side at the front
- Two yellow semicircular blocks are placed on top of the red arch blocks, fitting into the arched cutouts
- Two tall yellow rectangular blocks rise vertically from behind the semicircular blocks
- Two green rectangular blocks are positioned vertically at the back corners of the structure

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

Looking at the dictionary image, I've identified the following blocks needed:

1. Block index 1: Red arch block (left side of the structure)
2. Block index 2: Red arch block (right side of the structure)
3. Block index 14: Yellow semicircular block (left side, on top of arch)
4. Block index 14: Yellow semicircular block (right side, on top of arch)
5. Block index 11: Tall yellow rectangular block (left back)
6. Block index 11: Tall yellow rectangular block (right back)
7. Block index 8: Tall green rectangular block (left back corner)
8. Block index 8: Tall green rectangular block (right back corner)

# Assembly Order

{
  Step1: Move block with index 1
  Step2: Move block with index 2
  Step3: Move block with index 14
  Step4: Move block with index 14
  Step5: Move block with index 11
  Step6: Move block with index 11
  Step7: Move block with index 8
  Step8: Move block with index 8
}

The assembly begins with the base arch blocks, followed by the semicircular blocks that rest on them, then the tall yellow blocks behind them, and finally the green blocks at the back corners to complete the structure.
